oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Klassifizierung unbekannter Proben ökologischer und konventioneller Herkunft mittels FAS anhand von Trainingsdaten aus dem Vorjahr
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Strube, Jürgen
Stolz, Peter
Weibel, F.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Food security, food quality and human health
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Different sorts of apples coming from pairs of organic/conv. producers of different locations in Switzerland and Germany were retrospectively investigated in 2004 and prospectively classified in 2005 based on data measured by fluorescence-excitation-spectroscopy (FES) and subsequent discriminant analysis. The result was in 8 of 9 cases a correct identification of the method of production. In one case the data showed no difference.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Strube, Jürgen; Stolz, Peter and Weibel, F. (2007) Klassifizierung unbekannter Proben ökologischer und konventioneller Herkunft mittels FAS anhand von Trainingsdaten aus dem Vorjahr. [Classification of unknown organic and conventional samples by FES and train-ing data of preceding year.] Paper at: Zwischen Tradition und Globalisierung - 9. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, Universität Hohenheim, Stuttgart, Deutschland, 20.-23.03.2007.
